mainText.attr1: Gravity Drive:
Cycle gravity hop objects - KEY -
Enable/Disable Gravity Drive - KEY -
Set Gravity Drive Engage Speed - KEY -
Gravity Drive Overview:
The gravity drive is a fast mode of travel.
Although there are no speed limits in Void Destroyer, acceleration and deceleration can be a limiting factor.
The Gravity Drive allows you quickly accelerate and quickly decelerate, making it very efficient at reaching far away places.
Limiting Factors:
You can only - hop - to certain objects. These tend to be large objects such as bases and gates.
Furthermore - if there is a - hop - nearer to your intended target, you must use that hop first or travel outside its range.
To use the gravity drive you must first target a valid hop.
This is simplified via the G key (by default - you can also manually target a valid hop as well).

Once you have a valid hop targeted, you can lock it into the gravity drive - via the SHIFT + G keys (by default - you can also disengage the gravity drive via these same keys, or even cut it short while in travel).

Now that you have a valid hop targeted, and the gravity drive is locked in, you must accelerate towards the hop for the gravity drive to engage. To simplify this you can use the SHIFT + BACKSPACE keys (by default) to set your ships speed. Once your ship is traveling the proper speed towards the hop the gravity drive will engage.
Simple Use:
Target a hop (eg: base) - Press SHIFT + G and turn towards object
Tips and Tricks:
Once locked in, you can target other objects.
You don't strictly have to use SHIFT + BACKSPACE all that matters is the speed.
Use afterburners or other speed boosts to speed up the process.
You can disengage the gravity drive while it is active - so you can reach a position between hops.
On use complexity:

There have been a few players that voiced their opinions that gravity drive use is too complex - with too many keys. The purpose of the keys is to simplify the use not to complicate it. However giving options tends to sometimes confuse simple things. The G key (by default) gives you an easy access to see the valid hops. The SHIFT + BACKSPACE keys (by default) gives you a quick speed setting.
